00022 #include "system.h"
00023 #include "settings.h"
00024 #include "eeprom.h"
00025 #include "protocol.h"
00026 #include "report.h"
00027 #include "limits.h"
00028 
00029 settings_t settings;
00030 
00031 
00032 // Method to store startup lines into EEPROM
00033 void settings_store_startup_line(uint8_t n, char *line)
00034 {
00035   uint16_t addr = n*(LINE_BUFFER_SIZE+1)+EEPROM_ADDR_STARTUP_BLOCK;
00036   memcpy_to_eeprom_with_checksum(addr,(char*)line, LINE_BUFFER_SIZE);
00037 }
00038 
00039 
00040 // Method to store build info into EEPROM
00041 void settings_store_build_info(char *line)
00042 {
00043   memcpy_to_eeprom_with_checksum(EEPROM_ADDR_BUILD_INFO,(char*)line, LINE_BUFFER_SIZE);
00044 }
00045 
00046 
00047 // Method to store coord data parameters into EEPROM
00048 void settings_write_coord_data(uint8_t coord_select, float *coord_data)
00049 {
00050   uint16_t addr = coord_select*(sizeof(float)*N_AXIS+1) + EEPROM_ADDR_PARAMETERS;
00051   memcpy_to_eeprom_with_checksum(addr,(char*)coord_data, sizeof(float)*N_AXIS);
00052 }
00053 
00054 
00055 // Method to store Grbl global settings struct and version number into EEPROM
00056 void write_global_settings()
00057 {
00058   eeprom_put_char(0, SETTINGS_VERSION);
00059   memcpy_to_eeprom_with_checksum(EEPROM_ADDR_GLOBAL, (char*)&settings, sizeof(settings_t));
00060 }
00061 
00062 
00063 // Method to reset Grbl global settings back to defaults.
00064 void settings_reset() {
00065   settings.steps_per_mm[X_AXIS] = DEFAULT_X_STEPS_PER_MM;
00066   settings.steps_per_mm[Y_AXIS] = DEFAULT_Y_STEPS_PER_MM;
00067   settings.steps_per_mm[Z_AXIS] = DEFAULT_Z_STEPS_PER_MM;
00068   settings.pulse_microseconds = DEFAULT_STEP_PULSE_MICROSECONDS;
00069   settings.default_feed_rate = DEFAULT_FEEDRATE;
00070   settings.max_rate[X_AXIS] = DEFAULT_X_MAX_RATE;
00071   settings.max_rate[Y_AXIS] = DEFAULT_Y_MAX_RATE;
00072   settings.max_rate[Z_AXIS] = DEFAULT_Z_MAX_RATE;
00073   settings.acceleration[X_AXIS] = DEFAULT_X_ACCELERATION;
00074   settings.acceleration[Y_AXIS] = DEFAULT_Y_ACCELERATION;
00075   settings.acceleration[Z_AXIS] = DEFAULT_Z_ACCELERATION;
00076   settings.arc_tolerance = DEFAULT_ARC_TOLERANCE;
00077   settings.step_invert_mask = DEFAULT_STEPPING_INVERT_MASK;
00078   settings.dir_invert_mask = DEFAULT_DIRECTION_INVERT_MASK;
00079   settings.junction_deviation = DEFAULT_JUNCTION_DEVIATION;
00080   settings.flags = 0;
00081   if (DEFAULT_REPORT_INCHES) { settings.flags |= BITFLAG_REPORT_INCHES; }
00082   if (DEFAULT_AUTO_START) { settings.flags |= BITFLAG_AUTO_START; }
00083   if (DEFAULT_INVERT_ST_ENABLE) { settings.flags |= BITFLAG_INVERT_ST_ENABLE; }
00084   if (DEFAULT_INVERT_LIMIT_PINS) { settings.flags |= BITFLAG_INVERT_LIMIT_PINS; }
00085   if (DEFAULT_SOFT_LIMIT_ENABLE) { settings.flags |= BITFLAG_SOFT_LIMIT_ENABLE; }
00086   if (DEFAULT_HARD_LIMIT_ENABLE) { settings.flags |= BITFLAG_HARD_LIMIT_ENABLE; }
00087   if (DEFAULT_HOMING_ENABLE) { settings.flags |= BITFLAG_HOMING_ENABLE; }
00088   settings.homing_dir_mask = DEFAULT_HOMING_DIR_MASK;
00089   settings.homing_feed_rate = DEFAULT_HOMING_FEED_RATE;
00090   settings.homing_seek_rate = DEFAULT_HOMING_SEEK_RATE;
00091   settings.homing_debounce_delay = DEFAULT_HOMING_DEBOUNCE_DELAY;
00092   settings.homing_pulloff = DEFAULT_HOMING_PULLOFF;
00093   settings.stepper_idle_lock_time = DEFAULT_STEPPER_IDLE_LOCK_TIME;
00094   settings.decimal_places = DEFAULT_DECIMAL_PLACES;
00095   settings.max_travel[X_AXIS] = (-DEFAULT_X_MAX_TRAVEL);
00096   settings.max_travel[Y_AXIS] = (-DEFAULT_Y_MAX_TRAVEL);
00097   settings.max_travel[Z_AXIS] = (-DEFAULT_Z_MAX_TRAVEL);
00098   write_global_settings();
00099 }
00100 
00101 
00102 // Reads startup line from EEPROM. Updated pointed line string data.
00103 uint8_t settings_read_startup_line(uint8_t n, char *line)
00104 {
00105   uint16_t addr = n*(LINE_BUFFER_SIZE+1)+EEPROM_ADDR_STARTUP_BLOCK;
00106   if (!(memcpy_from_eeprom_with_checksum((char*)line, addr, LINE_BUFFER_SIZE))) {
00107     // Reset line with default value
00108     line[0] = 0; // Empty line
00109     settings_store_startup_line(n, line);
00110     return(false);
00111   } else {
00112     return(true);
00113   }
00114 }
00115 
00116 
00117 // Reads startup line from EEPROM. Updated pointed line string data.
00118 uint8_t settings_read_build_info(char *line)
00119 {
00120   if (!(memcpy_from_eeprom_with_checksum((char*)line, EEPROM_ADDR_BUILD_INFO, LINE_BUFFER_SIZE))) {
00121     // Reset line with default value
00122     line[0] = 0; // Empty line
00123     settings_store_build_info(line);
00124     return(false);
00125   } else {
00126     return(true);
00127   }
00128 }
00129 
00130 
00131 // Read selected coordinate data from EEPROM. Updates pointed coord_data value.
00132 uint8_t settings_read_coord_data(uint8_t coord_select, float *coord_data)
00133 {
00134   uint16_t addr = coord_select*(sizeof(float)*N_AXIS+1) + EEPROM_ADDR_PARAMETERS;
00135   if (!(memcpy_from_eeprom_with_checksum((char*)coord_data, addr, sizeof(float)*N_AXIS))) {
00136     // Reset with default zero vector
00137     clear_vector_float(coord_data);
00138     settings_write_coord_data(coord_select,coord_data);
00139     return(false);
00140   } else {
00141     return(true);
00142   }
00143 }
00144 
00145 
00146 // Reads Grbl global settings struct from EEPROM.
00147 uint8_t read_global_settings() {
00148   // Check version-byte of eeprom
00149   uint8_t version = eeprom_get_char(0);
00150   if (version == SETTINGS_VERSION) {
00151     // Read settings-record and check checksum
00152     if (!(memcpy_from_eeprom_with_checksum((char*)&settings, EEPROM_ADDR_GLOBAL, sizeof(settings_t)))) {
00153       return(false);
00154     }
00155   } else {
00156     return(false);
00157   }
00158   return(true);
00159 }
00160 
00161 
00162 // A helper method to set settings from command line
00163 uint8_t settings_store_global_setting(int parameter, float value) {
00164   if (value < 0.0) { return(STATUS_SETTING_VALUE_NEG); }
00165   switch(parameter) {
00166     case 0: case 1: case 2:
00167       settings.steps_per_mm[parameter] = value; break;
00168     case 3: settings.max_rate[X_AXIS] = value; break;
00169     case 4: settings.max_rate[Y_AXIS] = value; break;
00170     case 5: settings.max_rate[Z_AXIS] = value; break;
00171     case 6: settings.acceleration[X_AXIS] = value*60*60; break; // Convert to mm/min^2 for grbl internal use.
00172     case 7: settings.acceleration[Y_AXIS] = value*60*60; break; // Convert to mm/min^2 for grbl internal use.
00173     case 8: settings.acceleration[Z_AXIS] = value*60*60; break; // Convert to mm/min^2 for grbl internal use.
00174     case 9: settings.max_travel[X_AXIS] = -value; break;  // Store as negative for grbl internal use.
00175     case 10: settings.max_travel[Y_AXIS] = -value; break; // Store as negative for grbl internal use.
00176     case 11: settings.max_travel[Z_AXIS] = -value; break; // Store as negative for grbl internal use.
00177     case 12:
00178       if (value < 3) { return(STATUS_SETTING_STEP_PULSE_MIN); }
00179       settings.pulse_microseconds = round(value); break;
00180     case 13: settings.default_feed_rate = value; break;
00181     case 14: settings.step_invert_mask = trunc(value); break;
00182     case 15: settings.dir_invert_mask = trunc(value); break;
00183     case 16: settings.stepper_idle_lock_time = round(value); break;
00184     case 17: settings.junction_deviation = fabs(value); break;
00185     case 18: settings.arc_tolerance = value; break;
00186     case 19: settings.decimal_places = round(value); break;
00187     case 20:
00188       if (value) { settings.flags |= BITFLAG_REPORT_INCHES; }
00189       else { settings.flags &= ~BITFLAG_REPORT_INCHES; }
00190       break;
00191     case 21: // Reset to ensure change. Immediate re-init may cause problems.
00192       if (value) { settings.flags |= BITFLAG_AUTO_START; }
00193       else { settings.flags &= ~BITFLAG_AUTO_START; }
00194       break;
00195     case 22: // Reset to ensure change. Immediate re-init may cause problems.
00196       if (value) { settings.flags |= BITFLAG_INVERT_ST_ENABLE; }
00197       else { settings.flags &= ~BITFLAG_INVERT_ST_ENABLE; }
00198       break;
00199     case 23: // Reset to ensure change. Immediate re-init may cause problems.
00200       if (value) { settings.flags |= BITFLAG_INVERT_LIMIT_PINS; }
00201       else { settings.flags &= ~BITFLAG_INVERT_LIMIT_PINS; }
00202       break;
00203     case 24:
00204       if (value) {
00205         if (bit_isfalse(settings.flags, BITFLAG_HOMING_ENABLE)) { return(STATUS_SOFT_LIMIT_ERROR); }
00206         settings.flags |= BITFLAG_SOFT_LIMIT_ENABLE;
00207       } else { settings.flags &= ~BITFLAG_SOFT_LIMIT_ENABLE; }
00208       break;
00209     case 25:
00210       if (value) { settings.flags |= BITFLAG_HARD_LIMIT_ENABLE; }
00211       else { settings.flags &= ~BITFLAG_HARD_LIMIT_ENABLE; }
00212       limits_init(); // Re-init to immediately change. NOTE: Nice to have but could be problematic later.
00213       break;
00214     case 26:
00215       if (value) { settings.flags |= BITFLAG_HOMING_ENABLE; }
00216       else {
00217         settings.flags &= ~BITFLAG_HOMING_ENABLE;
00218         settings.flags &= ~BITFLAG_SOFT_LIMIT_ENABLE; // Force disable soft-limits.
00219       }
00220       break;
00221     case 27: settings.homing_dir_mask = trunc(value); break;
00222     case 28: settings.homing_feed_rate = value; break;
00223     case 29: settings.homing_seek_rate = value; break;
00224     case 30: settings.homing_debounce_delay = round(value); break;
00225     case 31: settings.homing_pulloff = value; break;
00226     default:
00227       return(STATUS_INVALID_STATEMENT);
00228   }
00229   write_global_settings();
00230   return(STATUS_OK);
00231 }
00232 
00233 
00234 // Initialize the config subsystem
00235 void settings_init() {
00236   if(!read_global_settings()) {
00237     report_status_message(STATUS_SETTING_READ_FAIL);
00238     settings_reset();
00239     report_grbl_settings();
00240   }
00241   // Read all parameter data into a dummy variable. If error, reset to zero, otherwise do nothing.
00242   float coord_data[N_AXIS];
00243   uint8_t i;
00244   for (i=0; i<=SETTING_INDEX_NCOORD; i++) {
00245     if (!settings_read_coord_data(i, coord_data)) {
00246       report_status_message(STATUS_SETTING_READ_FAIL);
00247     }
00248   }
00249   // NOTE: Startup lines are handled and called by main.c at the end of initialization.
00250 }
